results.title: SEO Content Specialist
results.description:
SEO Content Specialist

UK Based - Remote

Spotlight Sports Group is a global media and technology company specialising in sports betting content and data. We have over 500 staff, and operate multiple award-winning B2C brands including Racing Post, MyRacing, Soccerbase & Free Super Tips in the UK. In the US we operate Pickswise & Fantasy Alarm. Our other businesses in the group are ICS-digital and ICS-translate. Our global B2B division provides sports betting and fantasy sports content, media partnerships (including a joint venture with Spanish publisher, AS) & much more.

We are operating a hybrid working policy with a flexible approach to when and where our people work.

 

Job Purpose

This role will be situated in the Content SEO team, working across Spotlight Sports Group’s affiliate B2B partnerships in the Sports Betting & Gaming industry in the US. Your role as SEO Content Specialist will be to support the Commercial Content team through the planning and optimisation of transactional content designed specifically to convert users. You will be responsible for keyword research, writing content optimisation specifications, and analysing performance to identify actionable, data-driven insights to grow visibility in search.

 

Key accountabilities:

  • Support the delivery of the SEO & Commercial Content Strategy to drive incremental traffic and conversion
  • Conduct keyword research, categorise into topical clusters and track performance over time to analyse performance
  • Conduct competitor analysis to identify keyword gaps and new opportunities for growth
  • Analyse SERP performance and identify opportunities for both quick and long term wins
  • Optimise on-site elements across the site including Header tags, metadata, internal links and schema markup
  • Regular reporting of core KPIs including search performance, keyword rankings, site visibility improvements and conversion metrics.

 

Requirements

  • An all-round knowledge of major US sporting events
  • Knowledge and experience of the US Sports Betting industry
  • Previous experience within an SEO role, with a strong understanding of on-site SEO
  • Up-to-date with the latest SEO trends and best practice
  • Experience working with platforms such as Google Search Console & Google Analytics
  • Experience working with SEO tools such as SEMRush and Ahrefs
  • Strong Microsoft Office and/or Google Drive skills

 

We are looking for people who share an affinity for our values:

Trust is Everything

We are One Team

We are Focused but Flexible

Our goal is Excellence

If you feel aligned to these values, we would love to hear from you.

Benefits

The position will come with a competitive salary, bonus, 25 days holiday, Private Healthcare and a great pension. We also give you your birthday off. We think we have an amazing working environment and culture and hope you will do too.

results.title: Brand Manager
results.description:
**This is a virtual / 100% remote position based in the U.S.**

JOB DESCRIPTION

Functional Nutrition Alliance offers in-depth Functional Nutrition training for health providers of all levels. Full Body Systems, our core nutrition immersion program, skillfully blends the art of practice with the science of nutrition. Functional Nutrition Alliance was founded by Functional Medicine Nutritionist Andrea Nakayama to help coaches and clinicians develop the skills needed to help anyone, no matter their signs, symptoms, or diagnoses.

The Functional Nutrition Alliance brand manager has two critical roles; the first is to be the guardian of the brand and responsible for ensuring that the products, services, and marketing efforts resonate with current and potential students/customers. The second critical role is to develop effective brand marketing strategies, promote growth and expansion of brand awareness with target personas, author and implement brand content marketing plans.

The ideal candidate will be skilled in using data to demonstrate the impact of brand management and brand marketing efforts on revenue and profitability objectives.

DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

Strategy/Opportunity

● Be the brand champion and expert and ensure brand integrity in all respects

● Develop brand positioning and messaging in partnership with key stakeholders; demonstrate an understanding of customer demographics and segmentation

● Analyze brands of competitors, consumer trends and buying behaviors

Collaboration

● Develop a deep understanding of the brand DNA/history, gain input on key strategies, and gain alignment on key messaging points they will be communicating

● Create and deliver content marketing campaigns across appropriate channels leveraging new and existing content

● Collaborate with paid media acquisition marketing team to ensure consistent brand messaging and to identify opportunities for content marketing campaigns to improve paid media results (and vice versa)

Accountability

● Set and rigorously evaluate the budget for content marketing

● Contribute to sales forecasts and relevant financials and reporting

● Ensure content across channels; including digital media/assets, artwork, print, and press releases, all align with brand strategy

● Ensure that marketing and communication efforts adhere to agreed goals, timelines, and manage expectations with various stakeholders

Requirements

REQUIRED KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, AND ABILITIES

● Strong understanding of brand architecture; able to organize brand priorities, generate original concepts based on consumer and business needs, and develop compelling narratives to communicate ideas

● Experience developing and executing effective content marketing strategies

● A broad set of strategic skills and experiences across brand, content, user experience, digital marketing, social media and campaigns, and digital transformation

● Experience in brand management and/or content marketing in nutrition, health, or wellness verticals


PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS

This position takes place in a virtual office environment and there are no unusual physical demands. Travel may be required from time to time depending on role.

WORKING CONDITIONS

This role requires an understanding of working in and with a virtual workforce. All applicants are expected to be successful working independently in a virtual setting.

EEO STATEMENTS

Empowered Education and its subsidiaries (Health Coach Institute, Functional Nutrition Alliance, Nutritious Life Studio, and Working Against Gravity) is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all our team members.

Benefits

Empowered Education (the “Company”) is proud to have selected the following comprehensive benefits package to meet your personal and family needs. • Health Insurance | Dental Insurance | Vision Insurance • Basic Life Insurance & AD&D • 401(k) Retirement Savings Plan • *Supplemental Accidental Death & Dismemberment Insurance • *Short & Long-Term Disability Insurance Additional Justworks Benefits Programs • Pre-Tax Commuter Benefits • Talkspace • Health Advocate • Kind Body • One Medical Additional EE Benefits & Perks • Paid Time Off • Paid Holidays • Paid Volunteer Time | Paid Voting Time • Paid Family Leave • Equity For All • Free access to our school’s programs • Fully Remote Workforce • Technology Allowance • Wellness Program

results.title: Marketing Manager
results.description:
Trilateral Research have a fantastic opportunity for a Marketing Manager to lead the execution of our commercial marketing activities. You’ll be responsible for presenting our products and services in ways that will strengthen our brand and boost sales.

 

Our company and what we do

At Trilateral Research we feel passionately about making the world a better place by providing Ethical AI solutions to tackle complex social problems. With award-winning services in research, data protection and cybersecurity, ethics innovation and sociotech insights, our team takes an end-to-end approach that fully integrates the technical, legal and social science dimensions of a problem. This helps our clients answer the right questions, analyse the right data and get meaningful insights to focus their action for the greatest impacts.

 

Our ethical AI has a tangible impact in the fight against the biggest challenges we are currently facing such as modern slavery and human trafficking, climate action, child exploitation, human security in conflict and crisis settings, and many more.

 

What are your responsibilities?

  • Study and understand our business model, products and services
  • Deliver against a varied portfolio of quarterly marketing objectives, inclusive of ensuring appropriate messaging for target audiences and lead generation. This includes, but is not limited to digital campaigns, contact development and audience segmentation, secure event speaking/advertising slots, award opportunites & coordinate marketing support for event participation, third party publications aimed at our target market(s).
  • Ensure thought leadership is promoted in a synergistic manner from our Innovation & Research clusters to further promote our commercial offering.
  • Leverage agile project management methods to ensure on-time, high quality, and efficient delivery against objectives.
  • Agree KPIs with Senior Management on a quarterly level, and monitor and evaluate marketing performance on a month basis, providing suggestions for enhancing marketing success.
  • Line manage staff in the marketing team.

What skills and experience you will bring to the role:

  • Proven experience as a Marketing Manager or similar role
  • Background in design and copywriting is a plus
  • Experience in market analysis
  • Familiar with product marketing tactics (e.g., integrated marketing campaigns)
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • Strong project management skills with ability to plan, execute and evaluate. Experience in using agile methods and project management software (e.g., Jira/Trello) is a bonus.
  • Experience in managing others.
  • Analytical mind and strong quantitative skills
  • Postgraduate qualification (or related certification in) in Marketing, Communications or similar field

 

About us

Our culture is based on delivering high-quality outputs, through our commitment and passion for what we do. We work in an open and collaborative environment where the team culture provides support amongst peers and colleagues. We believe in the strength of a diverse, gender-balanced environment with positive work-life balance, and value the passion and talents of our team.

 

Find out about our people and culture, and see how our mission drives the research projects we take on, the key data protection services we provide, and the technology products and supplementary services we develop, by visiting our website Trilateral Research.

 

What else do I need to know?

Our compensation package includes:

  • Competitive salary
  • Flexible working hours
  • Remote working/working from home options
  • Competitive pension scheme (applies to permanent contract only)
  • Continuous career development

 


Location: This position is open to candidates based in the UK/IE

Salary: Commensurate with experience

Hours: Full Time

Contract Type: Fixed-Term or Permanent

 

How to apply

Please submit both your CV and a cover letter, linking your experience to our requirements in order to have your application considered. References will be required prior to appointment and candidates must be eligible to work in the UK/IE.

 

We are an Equal Opportunities employer and positively encourage applications from suitably qualified and eligible candidates, regardless of their age, sex, race, disability, sexual orientation, gender reassignment, religion or belief, marital/civil partnership status, or pregnancy and maternity. We are a Disability Confident committed and Living Wage employer.

 

At Trilateral Research, we value privacy and data protection rights. We have a longstanding data protection culture and promote robust ethical standards in data management and research ethics. Please read our Recruitment Privacy Notice in relation to our recruitment activities before submitting your application to work with us.

results.title: Director, Product Marketing
results.description:
About Forma

The market for employee benefits is broken. Companies spend millions annually on employee benefits that employees neither value nor regularly use. Founded in 2017, Forma set out to build a better model by challenging traditional one-size-fits-all approaches.

Forma’s flexible benefits software helps companies offer competitive benefits packages while reducing costs and inefficiencies, by giving employees more choice and flexibility in how they spend their benefit allowances. The platform also saves HR professionals countless hours managing and supporting various point solutions.

Using Forma, companies can select from a suite of products that include Lifestyle Spending Accounts, Health Spending Accounts, Health Reimbursement Arrangements, Flexible Spending Accounts, and more to design and deliver customized benefits programs–all through a single platform. Employees then have three choices to spend account funds: The Forma Store with discounted products and services, The Forma Visa Card, or claim reimbursement backed by Forma’s world-class member support team.

Forma has helped hundreds of the world’s most admired companies, including Stripe, Zoom, Lululemon, and Affirm, design and support flexible, inclusive benefits programs for nearly a million employees. And, we are seeing great success with 98% customer retention, 75 NPS, and 98 CSAT ratings from members.

Forma is backed by Emergence Capital and Ribbit Capital and has received numerous awards for its exponential growth, its software innovation, and as a “Great Place to Work.”

About the Role

You will be Forma’s first product marketing leader. Forma is full of product experts, we need more market experts. Forma is looking for someone who is wired to understand that good marketing starts with understanding the “whys”, solving problems, and helping prospects realize that the status quo is hurting them.  The product marketing leader will own a variety of activities including positioning refinement, product launches, sales enablement, competitive analysis, and analyst relations. Additionally, they will support a broad range of marketing activities with content development and speaking engagements. This is a highly cross-functional role with stakeholders across product, engineering, sales, marketing, and the leadership team and is fantastic exposure for someone looking to develop their marketing leadership skills.

You Will

  • Become an expert on Forma’s industry, customers, and technology

  • Manage the product launch process: serving as the liaison between our product/engineering department and the GTM functions to ensure we have coordinated enablement, GTM, and positioning

  • Develop sales enablement materials and collateral including research, presentations, data sheets, webinars, web pages and product videos

  • Constantly triage sales support and enablement requests for collateral and positioning

  • Get to know the competition better than they know themselves

  • Conduct win loss analysis to keep the pulse on our buyers, the market, and where we need to improve

  • Share a stage: support Forma’s evangelism by speaking at events and on webinars

  • Create, position and launch innovative marketing campaigns and content that drive awareness and preference for our industry leading products

  • Help external industry analysts and influencers view Forma as a leader in flexible benefit

  • Roll up your sleeves as a full-stack marketer whenever the broader team needs help

  • Build out and manage the product marketing team as we grow

Preferred Skills

  • 7+ years of product marketing experience in B2B SaaS

  • Ability to own a stage with clear, authoritative public speaking

  • Exceptional written and verbal communication skills with the ability to convey complex concepts in simple terms

  • Proven ability to work independently, in a fast-paced environment

  • Able to move seamlessly between strategy and tactical execution

  • Startup or entrepreneurial spirit with the willingness to jump in and get your hands dirty

  • MBA preferred.

Benefits and Perks

  • Remote-first working environment

  • Medical, dental and vision insurance plans

  • Employee wellness program

  • Home Productivity program

  • Team building program

  • 401(k) savings plan

  • Flexible PTO policy

  • 12 weeks Parental Leave + 4 additional weeks for the Birthing Parent

At Forma, we value diversity, and always treat all employees and job applicants based on merit, qualifications, competence, and talent. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

Duties and responsibilities may not all be covered in the description, or may change over time at the discretion of Forma. You're encouraged to apply even if your experience doesn't precisely match the job description. Your skills and passion will stand out—and set you apart—especially if your career has taken some extraordinary twists and turns. At Forma, we welcome diverse perspectives, and people who think rigorously / aren't afraid to challenge assumptions. Join us!

results.title: Senior Partnerships and Strategy Lead
results.description:
About Us:

Forage is a mission-driven payments company helping merchants accept EBT/SNAP payments online and enabling 42 million Americans to spend their food benefits on the internet.

We are a remote-first company, with team members spread across North America.

 

What we are looking for:

Forage is looking for an experienced business development leader to lead the company’s partnerships strategy, build relationships with large, strategic grocery partners as well as partners across fintech, advertising, and more.

This is a business critical role to Forage as it builds its portfolio of merchants. This role will focus on the largest grocers across the nation, building deep relationships. This role will be responsible for bringing in leads, tracking leads, and analyzing business opportunities and identifying new opportunities. It will lead contract negotiations including deal economics.

It will work closely with product, tech, and company leadership, reporting to the Chief Business Officer. 

 

Basic Qualifications:

  • 8+ years professional experience within Business Development or Consulting

  • Bachelor's degree or equivalent

 

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Experience in E-Commerce, Grocery retail, Consulting, Payments/FinTech, or B2B 

  • Experience working with regulated payments such as SNAP and CashEBT

  • Preferred Education: Masters in Business Administration (MBA)

  • Experience and expertise communicating/influencing C-level business decision makers

  • Experience negotiating complex deals

  • Comfort working in ambiguous environments

 

Our Offer:

As of 10/12/22, if we hire you in San Francisco, your base salary would fall within the bands below. Please keep in mind that the equity portion of your offer is not included in these numbers and represents a significant part of your total compensation.

  • Base Compensation:

    • Manager, Strategic Partnerships, MGR5: $120,000 - $178,000 base

    • Senior Manager, Strategic Partnerships, MGR6: $130,000 - $196,000 base

    • Director of Business Operations, MGR7: $145,000 - $218,000 base

  • Meaningful work that makes a positive impact on our society.

  • Competitive compensation: salary, equity, and benefits.

  • A remote-first work environment with opportunity for onsite meetings.

  • A fun and caring environment that prioritizes transparency, growth, and ownership.

  • A talented, diverse, high-achieving, and humble team with diverse backgrounds and viewpoints.

 

We aim to review every application within 72 hours of submission and provide feedback on each of your interviews within 48 hours of completion. If you don't hear from us, please reach out to your recruiter or careers@joinforage.com directly to get an update on your candidacy.

results.title: CRM & Retention Marketing Manager
results.description:
This is a remote job, and is open to candidates based within the state(s) of California, Pennsylvania, Idaho, New York, Georgia, Florida, or Texas, and must have the right to work within the United States.

We're building the future of advertising and are looking for the minds to help us do it.

Darkroom is a digital growth agency building legendary e-commerce companies and digital experiences. We are a team of industry-leading marketers and best-in-class creatives building LA’s fastest-growing marketing agency. Taking the startup mindset to the agency space, the collective expertise of our team of entrepreneurs and senior digital marketers are deeply aware of the newest trends in e-commerce, development, and digital marketing. Our learned experience has allowed us to take clients (and internal ventures) from $0 to millions in revenue in just a few months. We work with game-changing brands: Crate & Barrel, Popchips, FEED, Olipop, & CALPAK, to name a few.

We are looking for a highly innovative, data-driven, and creative Senior Retention Marketing Manager, who’s motivated by the challenge of working with some of the fastest growing e-commerce and digital brands. You will lead a team of email, SMS and retention marketing industry experts to drive client revenue, partner with internal cross functional colleagues to go deeper on understanding our customer needs and insights with a specific focus on deepening retention and building loyalty. You will lead a cross-functional team to go deeper building creative strategies in email and SMS campaign development to help our clients grow.

You Should Apply if this sounds like you:

You’re passionate about e- commerce and digital marketing. You’re immersed in the world of direct-to-consumer growth marketing. We're looking for an expert Senior Retention Marketing Manager to join our team! In this role, you will lead a growing team within the Retention Marketing Department to strategically develop customized retention (and customer loyalty) marketing strategies that help our clients grow and scale.

  • 5+ years of work experience in digital marketing.

  • You’re passionate about developing creative customer journey’s that drive loyalty and lifetime value.

  • You’re passionate about building teams, training them on best practices, and helping them grow into experts.

  • You immerse yourself in scaling personalized D2C/e-commerce email and SMS programs that build deep customer relationships for clients.

  • You have experience working in Klaviyo (or a similar ESP’s) including list segmentation, lifecycle drip automations, and triggered events. Additionally, you have knowledge of Shopify and their tech stack options such as Privy, JustUno, Yotpo, Octane AI etc.

  • You have developed SMS and loyalty programming strategies and have experience working with SMS platforms such as Attentive, PostScript, SMSBump, or Klaviyo.

  • You're used to working in a fast paced environment and can project manage multiple tasks at once for yourself, your team and your clients.

  • You love making data driven decisions and excel at turning analytics into actionable SMS and email strategies that drive client revenue.

  • You dedicate time to learning and being on the cutting edge of trends and best practices in the world of DTC marketing.

  • You have experience developing and executing customer loyalty programs that enhance LTV

  • You've had at least one direct report before OR exceptional leadership skills working with cross-functional teams.

  • Excellent verbal and written communication and presentation skills, plus ability to clearly articulate and express complex and sometimes technical ideas to a wide variety of people and groups at any level.

A Day in the Life:

  • Serve as the senior point of contact for select clients, working to develop best-in-class retention strategies. On a weekly basis, you will meet with clients to discuss current and future initiatives.

  • Conduct weekly 1:1s with your direct reports and manage their workload and capacity to ensure their success. Additionally, you will help train the team to help your direct reports succeed and grow.

  • Develop strategic campaign calendars and prioritize projects and initiatives designed to scale your clients’ email and SMS programs.

  • Provide support and guidance to help Retention Specialists analyze data, develop winning retention strategies and create reports for clients happiness.

  • Project manage and delegate client tasks to your team, consisting of both specialists and designers. Review all client briefs and designs for approval before they are sent to the client.

  • Coordinate cross-departmentally with the Performance Marketing and Strategy teams to develop cohesive and creative campaigns that drive client growth.

  • Develop strategic KPI’s for clients and work with the retention team to create insights and actionable recommendations.

  • Execute on automation/flow logic set-up, pop-up builds, and app integrations.

What its like to work at Darkroom:

We only seek out the best—from our clients to our people. Our team is our most sacred asset, and we offer highly competitive salaries and the following perks:

  • Darkweek, Unlimited Vacation Policy, and Holidays: Rebooting is one of the most important parts of growth. At Darkroom, you have access to a flexible vacation policy, our annual “Darkweek” summer break, and 10 holidays throughout the year to keep you recharged and sharp.

  • Location, location, (or no) location: Remote-first culture with a strong community base. With Hubs in LA, The Bay Area, New York, Philly, Lisbon, and Eastern Europe.

  • Health & wellness: Company-sponsored medical, dental, and vision benefits with, so you can stay as healthy as can be.

  • Finances, growth, and retirement: After one year with Darkroom, we deliver a robust 401k program with company match, equity incentives, and a profit-sharing opportunity so we can help you save as the company grows.

  • Endless opportunities for growth: Our agency is founded on an interdisciplinary approach, giving Darkroomers insights into services far beyond your job description. Grow your skills and interests beyond your niche and stay at the forefront of the industry through total immersion in cross-functional collaboration.

Our Hiring Process and Compensation:

The hiring process for this position typically follows four stages. We offer competitive salaries, and will be discussed further upon a phone interview.

Equal Opportunity Statement

Darkroom is an equal opportunity workplace—we are dedicated to equal employment opportunities regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national orientation, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity, or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements.

results.title: Social Media Specialist
results.description:
Founded in 1985, SelectQuote provides solutions that help consumers protect their most valuable assets: their families, health and property. The company pioneered the model of providing unbiased comparisons from multiple, highly rated insurance companies allowing consumers to choose the policy and terms that best meet their unique needs. Two foundational pillars underpin SelectQuote's success: a strong force of highly trained and skilled agents, who provide consultative needs analysis for every consumer, and proprietary technology that sources and routes high quality leads. The company has three core business lines: SelectQuote Senior, SelectQuote Life and SelectQuote Auto and Home. SelectQuote Senior, the largest and fastest-growing business, serves the needs of a demographic that sees 10,000 people turn 65 each day with a range of Medicare Advantage and Medicare Supplement plans.

Job Summary:

SelectQuote's digital marketing team needs a Social Media Specialist. The Social Media Specialist will work in coordination with the Director of SEO & Content Strategy, as well as members of other departments, to establish and execute strategy around SelectQuote ratings, reviews, and social media. This position will be responsible for organic social media initiatives across all divisions of SelectQuote, one of the country's preeminent national insurance brokerages.

The Social Media Specialist manages the execution of organic social media deliverables, channel monitoring, weekly reporting, and long-term social media and review/response strategy as it relates to the broader SelectQuote brand-building and business objectives. SelectQuote is looking for candidates with an entrepreneurial spirit and a creative approach to storytelling in the social media space.

Essential Functions:

  • Assist in the development and execution of data-driven social media strategy for SelectQuote (including platform consideration, content publishing, and response strategy)
  • Develop and refine a rating and review strategy for SelectQuote
  • Create, curate, and manage organic social content, including copywriting, design, and multimedia elements
  • Coordinate, schedule, and monitor organic social media content
  • Employ and leverage social listening strategies, including helping select appropriate tools and tech to aid in this effort
  • Manage social engagement, including responses to organic posts, ads, and tagged mentions
  • Manage SelectQuote reviews/ratings, including responding to reviews where applicable, answering questions, and routing customers to the appropriate departments when necessary
  • Monitor and advise on social media trends and help determine where/how these apply to SelectQuote
  • Plan for and lead organic social media campaigns, including tracking and reporting on the success/effectiveness of those campaigns
  • Develop meaningful insights around social media performance and areas of opportunity for SelectQuote
  • Routinely conduct competitive and market research
  • Collaborate with others on the marketing team to ensure all marketing initiatives and messaging are consistent and aligned with company and division goals

Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:

  • Deep understanding of content marketing and brand-building theory
  • Strong understanding of foundational social media elements and platforms, their audiences, and how to leverage them to maximize branding and lead generation efforts
  • Focus and attention to detail
  • Intellectual curiosity and an analytical mindset
  • Strong creative, verbal, and written communication skills
  • Solid organizational and time management skills
  • Able to analyze data sets and derive actionable insights from several data sources
  • Familiar with digital marketing, digital channels, and online marketing metrics
  • Resourceful and autonomous learner with the ability to deliver under pressure
  • Previous experience with copywriting, content marketing, and/or content strategy preferred

Training and Experience:

  • Bachelor's Degree in a relevant field and 2-3 years' of social media marketing experience
  • Experience developing, managing, and measuring social media campaigns for medium-to-large brands
  • Working knowledge of analytics software, content management systems, and SEO tools

Benefits:

It's an exciting time to join SelectQuote. We became a publicly traded company in 2020 with the first 100% virtual IPO (non-biotech) in American history. We have also been recognized nationally on the 2021 Top Workplaces USA list and by the Kansas City Business Journal as a 2020 Best Places to Work honoree.


Full-time employees are eligible for medical, dental, vision, voluntary short-term disability, company-paid long term disability, company-paid life insurance and accidental death & dismemberment (AD&D), 401(k) + company match and 100% vesting after 4 years, discretionary profit sharing, employee stock purchase program (espp), paid time off, floating holidays, paid maternity leave, paid parental bonding leave, tuition reimbursement, jury duty pay, and other paid leaves vary based on work location.

results.title: Content Manager, Social Media
results.description:
Product Hunt is a global community of makers, startuppy folks, early adopters, and product enthusiasts. We surface great new products every day, from crypto investing tools to mobile apps to wearables and beyond. Our mission is to amplify product makers who are using technology to build the future.

As a distributed team across 9 countries (like Bulgaria, France, India, UK, and the US), it's important to us to build an inclusive team – across gender, ethnicity, and experiences – to best serve our global community.

We're looking for a Social Media Manager who considers themselves to be a digital conversationalist and community builder. The right person for this role is someone who is deeply passionate about tech, has an entrepreneurial spirit, and is a creative thinker and skilled writer.  

About the job

You will:

  • Develop and own the strategy for Twitter, LinkedIn, and other channels with a focus on community building and real-time engagement. 
  • Think through our strategy for visual channels like TikTok, Instagram and YouTube. 
  • Help to lay the foundation for voice and tone across Product Hunt's social channels. 
  • Own the roadmap for regular content execution, both posting directly yourself and working with the team to collaboratively produce content and digital events (Twitter Space Panels, Town Halls, etc.).  
  • Seek and partner with makers and creators within and outside of the Product Hunt community to create and share content.
  • Keep your pulse on the heartbeat of tech, responding to breaking tech news and identifying / communicating trends and opportunities to the team. 
  • Monitor Product Hunt's brand awareness and share of voice among markets in social, reporting regularly to leadership. 

This role reports to the Content Lead and works within the Marketing Team, especially alongside our Editorial and Community team. You'll also work cross functionally with other Marketing members and divisions to support communications around things like product launches. 

About you

We're more interested in your experience, proven results, and passion for tech and community than your previous career titles. 

You might be…

  • A social media manager with 3+ years of experience who has scientifically mastered the art of the tweet
  • A creator or blogger who has grown a following for your interesting takes and thoughtful commentary  
  • A journalist who has covered tech startups or tech verticals for years and wants in on helping makers with great ideas flourish
  • A serial founder with a head full of wisdom, a keen understanding of relationship-building, and a way with words 

You're the kind of person who…

  • Is deeply curious and geeks out over tech and product trends. You're at the forefront of industry news daily.
  • Knows how to execute. You know your way around Twitter and Facebook (other community-driven sites like Reddit are a plus) with your eyes closed. 
  • Likes to experiment but is strategic, too. You hold strong opinions loosely — you know what makes a perfect thread but aren't afraid to try something new.  
  • Is quick with words. You pride yourself on your ability to create clever copy and think creatively. Typos make you cringe. Reparte is your bread and butter. 
  • But kind and thoughtful. You genuinely want to see great ideas succeed.

The salary for this role is dependent on location/cost of living and experience.

This full-time role is available for remote candidates from anywhere in the world, but you'll need to be available from 5am to 11am Pacific Time Monday-Friday. The rest of your hours can be worked flexibly at your convenience.

Compensation/Benefits

  • Salary: $45,000-$85,000 depending on experience and location
  • Gym stipend – Your health is important to us, too
  • Full health insurance coverage for you and your dependents if you live in the US and a generous stipend for outside the US
  • Fluid work schedule – We don't believe in face time, work when you're most productive (outside the hours noted above)
  • Generous vacation time – Hard work deserves time off, so please take it
  • Wellness Mondays. First Monday of the month is your time. Spend it however you want.
  • Live wherever – We don't care if you WFH or work from Hawaii. Our team was fully distributed before the pandemic and will continue as such.

results.title: Marketing Operations Manager
results.description:
ABOUT US

 

Sorted is a refreshingly agile and data-driven software company, powering dynamic checkouts, carrier management, delivery tracking and automating returns management around the world. Through partnerships with some of the biggest global carriers and customer-obsessed retailers, Sorted transforms every delivery journey into a 5* customer experience.

Trusted by leading global retailers – such as ASOS, Asda and Lush – Sorted’s delivery experience platform fixes poor delivery choice, broken customer promises and disjointed post-purchase communication to increase customer happiness, drive loyalty and support retail growth

With software now live in 17 countries, Sorted is recognised as one of fastest growing companies in Europe as named by the FT and one of the UK’s most successful digital businesses by Tech Nation’s Future Fifty, Europe’s leading late-stage growth programme.

We’re very ambitions with a brilliant team of over 100 talented people.

Our values guide our decisions, the way we work, our culture and the people we ask to join the team. We work hard, have fun and are united as a team when it comes to driving transformation forward – not just for our business, but transformation for the retail tech industry.

We’re not afraid to make mistakes (we’d never learn if we didn’t) and we’re always looking to challenge ourselves. Our style is collaboration based on honesty, transparency and looking forward.

We’re working hard to make Sorted great; we know the roller coaster will continue but, with great people and an exciting roadmap in place, now is the time to be part of our story.

If you’re inspired by what we’re doing, are up for a challenge and share our vision, we’d love to hear from you.

 

 

ABOUT THE ROLE

Reporting to the VP Marketing & Product Management, the Marketing Operations Manager is central to ensuring marketing programs run seamlessly through the delivery and optimisation of all marketing processes. You will own and develop the marketing technology stack, ensuring all platforms and tools in use support excellence in prospect and customer engagement and marketing best practice. You will also own and develop all marketing team reporting, tracking, retrospectives and performance insight, helping the team understand performance of campaigns and performance against pipeline goals.

 

The day-to-day stuff:

No two days are ever the same at Sorted so what you’ll be up to will vary. The pace we move at also means priorities will change and you’ll need to be comfortable with this (we’ll support you!). But these are the things that will be core to your role and will keep you busy.

  • Produce weekly, monthly and quarterly performance dashboards that drive a culture of continuous improvement, tracking campaign performance, performance vs pipeline goals, identifying gaps and using insight to make recommendations for remediation.
  • Champion use of our marketing automation platform, ensure democratisation of use across the marketing team by providing access to learning and coaching materials
  • Own the planning, execution and optimisation of email nurture programs within Hubspot and Salesloft
  • Budget responsibility for all platform and subscription spend.
  • Produce monthly board pack and business performance update
  • Own prospect database, ensuring data capture across the funnel is aligned with our ICP and Market segmentation model. Ensure sales and marketing teams are clear and coached on data best practice in line with GDPR policy.
  • Working with Marketing and Sales colleagues, continuously review the martech and salestech markets for solutions that will help us achieve our commercial goals; including but not limited to; Live-Chat, Sales Outreach, Sales Enablement, Data Enhancement.
  • Ensure CRM and Marketing Automation platforms are structured to support key lead to revenue processes and reporting
  • Work closely with sales operations to ensure data is syncing seamlessly in Salesforce, Hubspot, Salesloft and Demandbase.
  • Provide ad-hoc reporting to VP Marketing & Product Management and Exec team as required.
  • Ensure a library of lead to revenue process documentation is maintained
  • Ensure marketing, sales, customer success and finance teams are aligned with all systemic operational changes across the lead to revenue process.
  • Responsible for system administration and managing multiple integrations across the martech stack
  • Assist new starters with onboarding to ensure they are set up with the appropriate configuration across all platforms

Requirements

ABOUT YOU

  • Must have demonstrable experience owning and developing marketing automation and CRM platform use in B2B organisations.
  • Must be an advanced user of Salesforce and Hubspot.
  • Must be highly inquisitive, able to provide meaningful insights in data that drive performance optimisation recommendations.
  • Must be a natural problem solver, able to interpret business challenges and apply process and systemic solutions.
  • Must be in tune with B2B (particularly SaaS) Marketing and Sales best practice.
  • Must be comfortable dealing with large and complex data sets, manipulating them to deliver meaningful outputs.

And it would be super great if you had:

  • Experience syncing, running, and optimising Demandbase and Salesloft within a B2B marketing operation.
  • You know what it’s like to work in a scale up company and love the vibe (and sometimes chaos!).

Benefits

WHY YOU’LL LOVE WORKING HERE:

Aside from the role, the people, our culture and our mission, we have some other things that make Sorted a pretty awesome place to be. Here’s a few other things that our people love:

  • Share our success: We know our success is a credit to our talented and hard-working people, so every Sorted employee has share options.
  • Generous holiday allowance: How does 40 days per year sound? How about an extra day for your birthday also? You got it!
  • Work isn’t somewhere where you go, it is something that you do: Our roles are remote-first (within the UK), but our Manchester and London offices are always free, should you ever want to pop in for a day, a meeting, or a drink.
  • Develop with Sorted: your development is our priority. Have a goal in mind? Share it with us and let us help you achieve it. On top of our ongoing training programmes, you can use your £200 annual development fund on any training courses of your choice. We guarantee you’ll learn loads, and develop both personally and professionally at Sorted too.
  • Your well-being matters: Private Health for everyone that works here including optical and dental cover. We also give you Life Assurance, and everyone has access to our employee assistance programme.
  • Supporting your family: We offer qualifying Sorted employees of all genders a generous 20 weeks of fully paid time off to look after their new arrivals.
  • Pension: We match pension contributions up to 5%
  • Our team: we’re an energetic, sociable and talented bunch who are super passionate about what we do and determined to make a difference. We’re all in it together, we learn from each other, we’re genuine and we don’t have time for politics

Sorted wants applicants from all backgrounds and walks of life, we are an equal opportunity employer committed to creating an inclusive environment. If there is anything you need to help you participate fully in the interview process, we'd like to hear about that too, please just include it in your application.

Come join us!

results.title: Head of Marketing
results.description:
At Solar monkey we love making an impact by accelerating the transition to solar energy. We do this by giving solar installers super powers with our innovative software. This allows them to work much more effectively and install even more solar installations. With our software installers can easily design, sell and maintain solar power systems remotely. We are active in 3 countries and are about to expand our horizon internationally. We have seen the Dutch market grow x5 within 5 years and are ready to see the same impact in the rest of Europe!

 

The role of marketing is becoming increasingly important. Especially in new markets we need to start from scratch with very little brand awareness. To grow quickly we need to stir up the market, tell our story in appealing ways and attract the success we are looking for!

 

About the job:

Marketing is about telling the story of Solar Monkey. And we have some great stories to tell!

Your tasks and responsibilities will entail:

  • As head of marketing you are ultimately responsible for making sure that our stories get told with as much impact as possible. One key metric of course is the direct number of leads generated (SQL/MQL). But we see marketing much broader than just leads. Along the customer journey marketing is responsible for consistent story telling, helping our sales team to increase sales conversion and close more deals. Also marketing has a role for spreading the word helping us to gather job applicants or business partners. We believe there is much hidden value in just being out there and positioning ourselves as an authority in the market.

  • Although marketing is about storytelling, we aim to measure every single step in the process. You are responsible for making sure that every step can be measured and that this is done in a structured way. Using these insights you run an improvement cycle to continuously optimise our impact. We need to know the results and ROI of each campaign so we know what to scale up and what to scale down. Continuous experimentation and measuring results will help to find better ways.

  • You will lead the Marketing team at Solar Monkey. This is currently only 2 FTE, but we envision to grow to >5 FTE internally within a year. We also work with marketing agency Happy Horizon and a number of freelancers such as international copywriters. All will fall under your responsibility. You report directly to Jan Pieter, the CEO.

  • Which channels we use to expose our stories? Of course we have our own website that needs to be optimised on SEO and conversion. We use social media channels to increase exposure and generate traffic and leads. We advertise on Google, Linked in and through partners. And when we have something cool to share we make sure to connect with the press to help spread our message.

  • You keep abreast of what's going on in the market and incorporate it into marketing campaigns. SO you need to gain sufficient market insights to know what is intersting to share, and how to best reach our target audiences.

  • Also internally you are the face of marketing. You gather interesting stories from your colleagues and keep everyone updated on how we communicate with the outside world.

What's in it for you.

  • On top of the salary: Stock Appreciation Rights.

  • A training budget of 4% of your annual salary.

  • A Macbook

  • A challenging journey within an ambitious scale-up. Tons of responsibility and a good bunch of people to celebrate successes with.

  • Remote and Hybrid friendly culture. The flexibility to work where and when it fits you best and a budget to set up your workspace at home.

  • Monthly social events and quarterly strategy days (company wide events also for remote workers). Enough opportunity to have fun with your colleagues ;)

Where will you be doing this?

Our headquarters is in The Hague, and many creative ideas are best generated in real life collaboration. So it is useful if you can be at the office at least 1-2 days per week. We do have a remote friendly culture and in fact almost half the company works remote. So you will enjoy lots of freedom on where and when to do your work.

Who are we looking for?

  • Someone who is performance driven but who understands that health and wellbeing are a prerequisite for performing.

  • You have experience with SaaS and B2B marketing

  • You are creative and love to try new things. You are eager to learn and see failure as an opportunity, not something to be prevented.

  • You know how to set up a customer journey, measure all steps in the process and how to optimise results of each step.

  • Experienced in leading a team. The team is not super large, so we are not looking for a typical ‘manager’, more a pragmatic entrepreneurial type who gets things done with the team.

  • We want you to focus your storytelling on people. We love the personal touch and want you to engage with clients to really learn what they are up to. So you need to be outgoing enough to engage with them, rather than just working digital only.

  • Storytelling, copywriting should be one of your skills. You should be fluent in English. Dutch is nice to have. We can work around language skills through local copy writers. We will be active in 5 languages so it’s impossible for you to speak them all ;)

  • You should know how to visualise stories for maximum impact. Some skills in doing this yourself is useful.

  • You are located in the Netherlands. 

  • You are fluent in Dutch and English, Spanish, German, or French is a pre.

In order to have acquired those skills we think you would need 6+ years of experience in marketing. But to be honest, we don’t look much at resumes and would rather have you prove to use that you possess the required skills.

results.title: Product Marketing Manager
results.description:
Product Marketing Manager

Who We Are

Swyft Filings is an online filing service for business formations. More importantly, we're a company that has helped budding entrepreneurs start over 300,000 new businesses (and counting). We take a complex process and automate it to make it easier for small businesses and individuals to launch their business dreams without having to hire high-priced professionals or worrying about administrative headaches.

Since 2015, we've grown from a lawyer and two online entrepreneurs into a team 110 strong – and you can bet we're not done yet. We're proud to have been ranked as one of the fastest-growing companies in Houston, nationally by the Inc 5000, and we're also listed as a Top Workplace by the Houston Chronicle.

Overview
As a Senior Product Marketing Manager, you own the product marketing experience and will help drive real business growth by shaping product vision and consumer perception across our small business product portfolio. You will also contribute to the optimization of the post-purchase experience, focusing on cultivating the long-term relationship we form with our customers and collaborating with cross-functional teams to design, develop, launch, and grow our services and customer base.

You are strategic, analytical, creative, and detail-oriented and someone who loves to make an impact. Your roll-up-your-sleeves and get-it-done attitude is complimented by strong communication, relationship building, and project management skills. As an accomplished product marketer, you have experience partnering with product managers and large cross-functional teams to bring products/services to life. You pride yourself in thinking like our consumers and business partners, and you have a track record for delivering insights-driven marketing plans that produce excellent business results.
You will

  • Establish compelling positioning, packaging, and pricing for our core business products, differentiating us from our competition while effectively communicating our benefits to customers.
  • Manage the end-to-end small business customer journey, delivering a delightful experience that ensures a long-term relationship with Swyft Filings across the customer lifecycle.
  • Understand and evaluate the competitive landscape - becoming an expert on our competition; how they position themselves, their pricing, strategies, and report on changes they're making in a timely manner.
  • Drive go-to-market strategies, launches, and campaigns for your portfolio. Influencing product strategy, testing, research, and content roadmaps that result in moving the revenue needle.
  • Create and optimize messaging for your suite of products/services that resonate with prospective customers and optimize our position.
  • Conduct project planning activities and manage the execution of projects, taking end-to-end ownership from ideation, to planning, through execution.
  • Spearhead market research projects for your portfolio to better understand the market and gather intelligence to help inform product decisions and messaging.
  • Monitor business health and recommend product opportunities and contingency plans.
  • Monitor broader trends and changing consumer needs to develop actions plans for your business segments.
  • Work with cross-functional teams across Marketing, Product Management, UX/Creative, Customer Care, PR, Engineering, Legal, and Business Development to ensure a great customer experience.


You have

  • 8+ years of marketing experience, with at least 3 years specifically in Product Marketing – specifically for digital offerings a plus.
  • Experience driving nationwide campaigns, communications, and go-to-market initiatives and outcomes.
  • Excellent communication skills (written and verbal), comfortable presenting to executives and partners.
  • Proven track record collaborating with product managers and cross-functional teams such as: marketing, creative, legal, finance, operations, customer service, and quality assurance.
  • Experience influencing product strategy, design, development timelines, and processes.
  • Ability to apply consumer insights, research and testing to drive world-class marketing strategy.
  • Bachelor's degree required; MBA or higher degree preferred.

Benefits

  • Eligible for Medical, Dental, Vision, Life, and Disability Insurance on the first day of employment
  • 100% employer-covered medical, dental, and vision insurance for employee-only plans
  • 401(k) w/ company match
  • Company-issued laptop + Home office stipend
  • Competitive Paid Time Off
  • Remote-friendly Work Model with office options in Austin and Houston.
  • Parental Leave
  • Casual Dress Code
  • Free Branded SWAG
  • Healthy Snacks in the Office
  • Company Events
  • Peer recognition and rewards with Bonusly

results.title: Demand Generation Manager
results.description:
We're Apogee. Nice to meet you. At our core, we're an IT-services organization that happens to focus on higher education. We touch the lives of binge-watching, music-loving, game-playing, finals-taking, seminar-attending, class-selecting students by providing IT infrastructure that meets today's needs technology-savvy generation.

We work hard, celebrate success, and challenge everyone in our organization to be a problem solver. If you are as passionate as we are about the intersection of technology and education, join us today.

Apogee is searching for a talented marketing professional to nurture leads and present our managed IT services compellingly and thoughtfully.

They'll use email marketing and account-based marketing (ABM) tactics to engage with and advance prospects through the lead lifecycle.

Driven, enthusiastic, and innovative in their approach, the ideal candidate will leverage marketing automation (MAS) and ABM software to identifying buying intent and engagement and uncover new opportunities early in the buying journey.

We are looking for a gritty, high achiever who embraces challenges, goals, and performances metrics and is interested in having a direct impact on a high-growth company with a history of challenging the status quo in higher education.

This person will sit in marketing and closely collaborate with the sales team.

Apogee is headquartered in Austin, TX and we're open to hiring remotely for this position.

The salary range for the position is $75,000-$80,000 depending on experience.

You will:

  • Create the strategy, produce the assets (emails, landing pages, etc.), and build the programs for point-in-time and automated/triggered programs in Marketo to nurture leads.
  • Understand how best to leverage our technologies – Marketo, Demandbase, and Salesforce CRM – to aid in lead nurturing programs.
  • Analyze and understand the segments and profiles of our contacts database.
  • Track weekly performance metrics by program against monthly, quarterly, and yearly targets for marketing-sourced contacts, marketing-influenced contacts, and opportunities generated from marketing-sourced contacts.
  • Test and optimize messaging, offers, and online experiences to drive the best conversion rates.
  • Communicate with sales and other stakeholders about the lead nurturing process.
  • Have a strategic mindset and ability to successfully design, assemble, and execute nurture flows for contacts from a variety of channels including events.
  • Plan and implement segmented email nurture streams that increase response rates and engagement and drive measurable pipeline while also determining qualification based on lead behavior and funnel stage progression.
  • Work closely with sales team to advance the most promising opportunities through the funnel.
  • Leverage experience with A/B and multivariate testing to continually optimize the impact of campaign efforts.
  • Define segmentation criteria to manage prospect lists by buyer persona and service line for nurture programs.
  • Map and document the nurture strategy, automation processes, programs, and procedures.

Ideal Candidate

  • A star at creating compelling email copy, including subject lines that get emails opened and CTAs that convert.
  • A Salesforce and Marketo guru that knows how to segment audiences and craft offers that appeal to different sales and marketing funnel stages.
  • Has a thorough understanding of the marketing funnel and lead and sales lifecycle.
  • A proactive self-starter, demonstrating high initiative and critical thinking. Proven ability to think strategically, but with exceptional attention to detail in execution.
  • Experience working in higher education at a college or university or vendor serving higher education.
  • Highly collaborative and organized and understands how programs integrate into overall marketing campaigns.

Requirements

  • BA/BS required.
  • 4+ years of experience in email marketing or similar field, with the desire to learn more about account-based marketing.
  • Samples of email copy and nurture streams required.
  • Demonstrated Salesforce and Marketo experience, certification is a plus.
  • Demandbase or 6sense experience is a plus.
  • Has both technical (marketing automation program structure) and creative skills (email copy, content topics, hosting webinars, etc.).
  • Comfortable working in a fast-paced environment and building things from the ground up.
  • Ambitious, eager, and fun!

Benefits

Our employees enjoy benefits that make them more productive and contribute directly to the development of their professional skills. We want to be able to attract the best of the best and make sure they keep getting better so here is what we are offering:

  • An attractive salary
  • Health insurance plan including Health Savings Account matching program
  • Monthly technology stipend
  • Engineering and Technical teams receive cash bonuses for obtaining certifications
  • Maternity and Paternity leave
  • Peer recognition program
  • Career development programs

Diversity Commitment Statement

At Apogee, we believe education is a doorway to a fair and just society. Within our own walls, we stand committed to creating a healthy culture of diversity and inclusion, empowering one another as advocates for an inclusive workplace, and doing so transparently. Apogee employees founded three employee-led groups in 2020 including Diversity and Inclusion, Civic Awareness, and Apogee Veterans.

Accommodation Statement

If you require a reasonable accommodation in completing this application, interviewing, completing any pre-employment testing, or otherwise participating in the employee selection process, please direct your inquiries to Human Resources, hr@apogee.us.

results.title: Demand Generation Manager, ABM
results.description:
Company Description

WHO ARE WE?

Cloud Academy is a hyper-growth upskilling and reskilling SaaS company, focused on enabling enterprise customers to have full transparency and control over their tech workforce skills readiness. In a rapidly changing cloud technical landscape where there is an increasing tech skills gap in the market, combined with the difficulty organizations are facing to retain tech talent and the demands for numerous technical certifications, companies need the ability to manage these skills at scale more than ever. We help over 1000 customers visualize, assess, transform and measure their teams’ tech skills readiness through a unique Skills Intelligence Platform, powered by world class cloud training content. Companies like Warner Media, Deloitte, JP Morgan Chase and Walmart trust Cloud Academy with their technical cloud skills readiness at scale, so they can achieve their cloud business goals.   

We are a global team, with colleagues in over 14 countries worldwide. We are a diverse team that is innovative, collaborative, pragmatic and passionate about making an impact. We thrive on a common vision, we obsess about our customers and learners, and we take pride in the quality of our work. Most importantly, we know that individually we are only as good as our teams are, and we always have each others’ backs.  



Job Description

We are seeking driven, highly competent, and creative team players to join us on the next phase of our growth story, as we scale our winning products to help even more customers and learners.

ROLE DESCRIPTION:

As the Account Based Marketing Manager, you will take a leading role in helping grow and scale our ABM program, a primary piece of our go-forward strategy to help us achieve our revenue goals. This will include planning/launching marketing campaigns, measuring their impact, and partnering closely with the sales team.

 

Responsibilities:

  • Strategize, execute, and optimize a ABM strategy to help achieve sales goals, with a key focus on attracting new business.
  • Develop and deploy multi-channel ABM campaigns, including crafting strategy, aligning internal teams, and executing
  • Apply an experimentation mindset to ABM campaigns to drive, test, learn, and optimize
  • Iterate and optimize campaigns based on data and analysis of ABM campaigns and tactics
  • Collaborate with ABM leadership team (sales and marketing interlock) to select key accounts
  • Provide ongoing reporting, campaign insights and pacing toward goal to stakeholders
  • Work closely with marketing ops and business ops to support high-performance ABM marketing tools and integrations
  • Partner closely with AEs to ensure strong marketing and sales alignment



Qualifications
  • 5+ years of experience in account based marketing or similar field, with the desire to learn more about account based marketing strategy
  • Experience in Account Based Marketing for New Logo acquisition in the Enterprise B2B space
  • Highly organized and efficient with the ability to develop and execute against an evolving plan
  • Be bold, willing to try new things, and experiment on the edge!
  • Ability to clearly communicate new ideas, products, and campaigns to both internal and external stakeholders
  • Team player who is able to work both collaboratively and autonomously
  • Strong project management, time management, prioritization, and organizational skills
  • Experience managing and prioritizing multiple projects simultaneously
  • Demonstrated ability to achieve results working cross-functionally with sales, marketing, and product teams
  • CRM/marketing automation background nice to have, preferably Salesforce and Hubspot
  • Proactive self-starter, demonstrating high initiative and critical thinking
  • Proven ability to think strategically, but with exceptional attention to detail in execution



Additional Information

Benefits:

  • Competitive salary with a bonus plan
  • 401(k) with a Company match
  • Full benefits, including medical, dental, and vision with Aetna
  • Four weeks of paid vacation per year (that increases to five weeks after two years with the company!
  • Paid public holidays, sick days and 1 day to volunteer at your favorite non-profit per year
  • 6 weeks of fully paid parental leave once you hit the one year mark - inclusive of all parents, birth or adoption (pro-rated for less than 1 year tenure)
  • Lots of opportunity for growth! We believe in promoting our great people

We value diversity and are an equal opportunity employer at Cloud Academy. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

results.title: Head of Marketing
results.description:
Waracle is home to a diverse and inclusive community of technologists.

We collaborate with ambitious businesses on their most challenging technology and digital product missions. In your career at Waracle you can expect to work on a variety of projects within some of the UK’s biggest brands in Health Tech, Fintech or Clean Tech, gaining experience and exposure to a range of languages and technologies.

Our growth has been significant and sustained, recently recognised by Clutch as one of the Top B2B companies in the UK, we are constantly seeking top industry talent to join our team and grow our expertise.

Waracle adopt a remote first ethos and provide a set up allowance you can use towards a comfy chair or desk! We have office space available in Dundee, Edinburgh, Glasgow and London if you miss that buzz in the office. This role is a permanent position.

As our Head of Marketing, you’re a relationship-builder and creative mind, uncovering opportunities for positioning Waracle as a market-leading product digital consultancy. You will work across brand, campaigns and content to develop Waracles reputation among executives and decision makers and generating MQLs. You are a seasoned leader with excellent communication skills and love inspiring and coaching teams.

 

Responsibilities

  • To develop a deep understanding of our business and its marketing objectives.

  • Coordinate and collaborate with marketing colleagues, external vendors and other stakeholders to execute marketing plans across owned, earned and paid channels.

  • Build awareness of Waracle among C-suite executives and senior decision makers and develop our reputation as a leading digital product consultancy.

  • Ensure our content underpins our inbound and outbound (lead generation and ABM) marketing activity, ultimately ensuring we achieve our ambitious growth targets across demand (clients) and supply (talent).

  • Work with colleagues across the business to find and curate relevant marketing content from across Waracle’s ecosystem, in support of UK campaigns.

  • To be responsible for producing best-in-class new content and assets (including blogs, articles, video, infographics, podcasts, and other formats) aligned to campaigns.

  • To implement SEO best practice principles across content and web pages, to increase traffic and drive website conversions (lead generation).

  • Develop our analytics capability for gathering and interpreting data across our channels, analysing campaign activity, tracking performance and optimising campaign activity.

  • Collaborate with colleagues to track and measure brand performance, whilst monitoring competitor brand activity.

  • At all times, leverage research and data to develop actionable, insights-led strategies.

 

  • Extensive B2B marketing experience, ideally gained within the technology/technology consulting sectors

  • Deep experience coordinating campaigns across owned, earned and paid channels.

  • Experience of working at a strategic level, developing brand campaign strategies is essential.

  • A working knowledge of SEO and the latest Google algorithm updates, including experience of creating content distribution strategies in support of lead generation, lead nurturing and ABM activities.

  • Proven track record in campaign management and delivery is essential.

  • Strategic mindset with the ability to understand and translate business strategy into actionable marketing plans.

  • Experienced using research, data and analytics to identify and develop actionable insights.

  • A proven relationship builder, with excellent communication, negotiation and presenting skills.

  • A strategic thinker, commercially astute, with good analytical and reporting skill.




Research shows that underrepresented groups tend to only apply when they tick every box. So if you think you have the skills, but don't meet every single bullet point above, please still apply. We'd love to have a chat with you.

 

The recruitment process you can expect for this role is an initial call with your dedicated Talent Acquisition Partner who will chat with you about Waracle, what you are looking for in a new position, the salary for the role, notice period and benefits (the important stuff!). After that, will follow a 2 stage interview process where you have an opportunity to find out more about the role and show off your skills and experience. Your Talent Acquisition Partner will guide you through the whole process to your first day with us.

 

We love to have fun, make friends for life and spend time together outside of work! We have various events, days out, competitions and incentives throughout the year and here are some other benefits you can expect at Waracle.

 

🏡 Flexible working and a remote-first ethos

🏖 Holidays – 31 days per year and a day off on your birthday.

⏰ 35 hour working week

💸 Company Pension and personal financial advisor

📈 Free access to 1000s of personal development courses

🏥 Group Life cover and Medicash Cash Plan

🍼 Enhanced maternity and paternity leave

🍎 Macbook and home office set up budget

Plus much more!

results.title: Revenue Marketing Manager
results.description:
Developers Institute is a New Zealand owned business with a clear vision of solving the world's software engineering shortage by providing data-driven software development education.

We’re an ambitious scale-up in growth mode, on the lookout for like-minded people to join in on the journey and contribute to our vision of helping people succeed.

 

The Role

This is a Revenue Marketing Manager position like no other, working 100% remotely. You will be responsible for implementing strategy and delivering integrated campaigns while generating marketing leads and hitting revenue targets. We’re looking for a candidate with a growth mindset, a data-informed approach, and a drive to deliver results. You’ll also be comfortable on the tools, whether its new platforms or programmes, you thrive on developing your skill set.

Reporting to the GM of Operations, you will be creating, managing and evolving a scalable marketing plan that achieves new customer pipeline and revenue targets across a mix of channels. You’re comfortable analysing data based customer insights and trends to pivot when necessary.

 

What you’ll do

  • Implement our customer acquisition strategy and operational marketing plan
  • Serve as a subject matter expert on engagement, performance, and ROI metrics
  • Provide visibility into marketing campaign results, measure campaign effectiveness, and influence future decisions to optimise campaign strategies
  • Manage campaign budget with accountability for marketing ROI
  • Generate Marketing Qualified Leads (MQL) that meet our criteria of quality leads using our lead qualification framework and fit our ideal customer profile
  • Ensuring only high-quality Marketing Qualified Leads (MQL) are referred to the sales team for a direct follow-up to become Sales Qualified Leads (SQL)

Requirements

  • 5+ years of marketing experience with demonstrated success in online demand generation for technology companies
  • A track record of successful lead generation, nurture, and integrated marketing campaigns
  • Solid experience in B2C online marketing tactics and marketing and sales automation tools such as (Marketo, Outreach, Drift, LeanData and Salesforce, Hubspot, Dealhub, Wingman etc.)
  • In-depth knowledge of running B2C integrated marketing campaigns across multiple channels
  • Analytical mentality and a data-informed approach
  • Must be comfortable with a balance of day-to-day execution and understand how to implement strategic goals.
  • Experience managing external vendors and agencies
  • Exemplary work ethic; takes the initiative and thinks creatively to get the job done
  • Passion for growth marketing

Benefits

  • Market Rates: Our people are paid market rate salaries
  • Wellbeing: We invest in people to feel valued to grow a healthy workforce
  • Equal Pay: Our people are paid equally in the same role
  • Development: Our people are trained, developed and upskilled
  • Recognition: We celebrate our people's success
  • Flexibility: Our people balance their work responsibilities and personal time
  • Remote Working: Our people have the freedom and support to work remotely
  • Parental Support: Our people are supported with paid parental leave

Applications Close - 5pm Friday 2nd of December 2022.

results.title: Senior Digital Marketing Manager
results.description:
Want to join one of Forbes’ next billion dollar startups that’s backed by VCs such as Kleiner Perkins, Accomplice, Gradient Ventures (Google’s AI Fund), BoxGroup, Village Global, and many more? If so, Secureframe could be the place for you. Secureframe is on a mission to help organizations build trust and stay secure. Getting secure can take months, slowing a company’s speed-to-market and sales. We believe security—when done right—should accelerate innovation and growth. That’s why we started Secureframe.
 
We’re looking for a Senior Digital Marketing Manager to manage our paid media strategy, results and all relevant KPIs. The right candidate for the role is an incredibly data-driven paid media expert with a proven track record driving a high volume of opportunities into sales. You will need deep expertise driving leads and pipeline from Google SEM, paid social, retargeting, and display ads. You will work closely with all other marketing groups, sales, product and ops to create campaigns, analyze data, and optimize all aspects of our paid media strategy.
 
This role is fully remote in the United States or Canada.



What you'll do
  • Drive qualified leads into our database and sales team through a paid digital playbook that is constantly optimized
  • Increase efficiency in our payback period by reducing CPA and increasing the quality of pipeline
  • Build a complex ROI model that can report on campaign results, ad creative results and audience results by any relevant category
  • Constantly test across the core elements of audiences, ads, and offers across each campaign and channel
  • Work closely with relevant marketing groups to take new product launches, creative assets and campaign ideas to market



Who we're looking for
  • 5+ years of relevant digital marketing experience at a fast-growing B2B startup
  • Experience in the security, privacy and compliance spaces
  • Digital channel expert on top of all the latest ad platform algorithm changes
  • Experience managing a paid media agency and a large budget
  • A strong data-driven approach to decision making with experience building data models
  • The ability to work with a high volume of paid landing pages and custom tracking codes
  • A great project manager who can keep track of a high volume of requests and always hits deadlines
Secureframe is an equal opportunity employer. We aim to create an environment where every team member at Secureframe feels like they belong so they can have a greater impact on our business and customers. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.
 
Collaboration, connection, and having fun with colleagues is an important part of our culture as a remote first company.  Therefore, all employees must be able to travel by air to company offsites two to four times per year (reasonable accommodations will be made where appropriate).
